formalText: She is going to go to work and get as much done as she can to try to finish up this.

She was fine for most of the afternoon and then towards the end of the last like our that she was working.
She started shaking.

Then, she realized that she was panicking. She was able to hide this from everybody but ended up, leaving an hour early, which isn't that abnormal for her especially because right now hurts her hands.
But she ended up going to her parents place first because she didn't know that she would be able to make it.
Dr. Barnes decided like she called her back and so he put her back on the Seroquel.

She was Panic free for a few days and then the past couple of days.
She has been so sad again and suicidal again...

She thinks it's helping.
What's more like she was kind of really sad but usually like not that long but they weren't just like instant and go away.
They were like maybe 5 minutes or so.

It was like the physical feeling of uncomfortableness and tightness from anxiety.
There might have been there was possibly a thought about like she should kill herself to end this feeling and the feeling wouldn't go away.

Yesterday there was snow anyways, but she is this close to finishing her job and considering quitting right before the end when accept that was she leave on bad terms, but she just doesn't know that she could keep it together enough and if she keeps on feeling like this like that tightness just wasn't going away.
She can sort of put it away.
If they were doing like something distracting like watching an episode of something or like listening to a podcast.
But as soon as like the episode of podcast or whatever end it comes back.

Maybe there was she is just so uncomfortable and she has no way of like going like making it go away permanently.
It just seems hopeless and she thinks these drugs aren't stopping that feeling.
It does go away.
But she feels like she has no control over it.

It's happening more and more. The Seroquel isn't going to help either then. Well, she guesses it's helping some but it's not helping enough. She doesn't know if the imipramine has stopped working or something and she can't really go back on the Wellbutrin because it's really bad for anxiety, and she just feels like she has run out of options.

She feels like she probably can't wait until the end of winter to like start exercising but she doesn't really have any other choices, like maybe she'll get because then she could have time and then she could join a gym or something.
She thinks the winter is driving her crazy.
When she finds out there's going to be more snow is just makes her so sad.
She can't deal with winter anymore.
She wants to be able to go on walks and stuff.
She doesn't really foresee herself having time to do it for the next few days.

She is also afraid that you know now she is starting to feel older than all the people in the group and if that's going to be an issue right now if she comes back she wouldn't be the oldest member of the group.
She guesses it's the depression is what stops her to anxiety.

Well, though just a part of her now thinks she is making a huge mistake by wanting to join music again.
She doesn't know if that's the depressed part of her or the sensible part of her.
She thinks she is afraid.
She is afraid that it's going to be work rather than enjoyable.
It's been so long that she can deal with that feeling it drives her crazy half the time.

So then he was sleeping in and then she didn't get up until 10:30 and he didn't get up until like 11.

She had her game. The alarm went off and they had like more time that they could sleep.
